Eva...as you had mentioned of stress, I have what hopefully is a wonderful chapter on that topic in my upcoming book on reversing heart disease.

I think of stress as "kryptonite", in that all of us should minimize our exposure, or what we choose to allow to enter into our being. This is very damaging, as stress actually is corrosive to our arteries and internal organs, and of course can weigh very heavy on our emotional state.

A great thought is not to get upset or frustrated about what one can't control. In your case that could be a multitude of things involved with travel, from setting up a trip or a trek, to delayed flights, lost luggage, a camel that doesn't want to behave, and of getting from point a to b, and then from b to c, and subsequently to d and e, without any delays, and no technical issues with your work. Now likely, the corona virus is on that list.

So, with all of that stuff, the best thing is to let it flow like water off a ducks back. Don't let it get into your gut so you wind up tromping around Pakistan looking for some Tums. You accept all of that and more as a part of your life, and know that the important thing is whatever the circumstances, you will put forth your best efforts. Then, no matter the result, you can accept that you put out your best.

If things didn't work out as you desired, then don't get stressed out from what happened, as you can't go back in time to fix things, but you can move forward with a good spirit, knowing that another day brings a new set of opportunities.

Some days our best is absolutely brilliant, and other days it totally sucks, but whatever it is, we must be good with that, and not beat ourselves up over what we can't control.

Other things that you can't control are people. You seem to be an astonishingly polite, positive, and fun lady, but, I would venture that you might have more than few stories of those who weren't so well mannered. I guess that was the polite way of saying they acted like jackasses.

As you know, don't internalize the bad experience, nor give anybody free rent in your mind by retelling of how awful that person was to your friends and family, as each rendition adds another layer of stress that you are carrying around. One may not know the circumstances another is dealing with, which doesn't excuse their behavior, but merely recognize they have some issues, forgive them, and pray for their well being. That you likely do.

Only get upset for the really, really important stuff. As far as relationships, you likely know that your happiness shouldn't be dependent upon whether somebody in your life is behaving with love and consideration or acting like a jerk.
